docs.lead_paragraph: This Sunday's talk shows are serving it up homestyle, focusing on the issues closest to home, with health care reform taking center stage. Administration officials and leading Senate Democrats will hammer out their arguments, with Republicans on to make their counterpoints.
docs.abstract: Health care legislation likely will dominate the discussions on the news shows.
docs.snippet: Health care legislation likely will dominate the discussions on the news shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jonathan Skinner is a professor of economics at Dartmouth and a co-author of the 2008 Dartmouth Atlas of Health Care.
docs.abstract: An economist responds to criticisms of research showing vast differences between regions in health-care spending and suggesting that higher-spending regions do not get better results.
docs.snippet: An economist responds to criticisms of research showing vast differences between regions in health-care spending and suggesting that higher-spending regions do not get better results.

docs.lead_paragraph: Back in the day, my old friend James Surowiecki used to write a blog for Slate every Friday, in which he dashed off snappy little items about the week's business -- to prepare readers for cocktail chatter over the weekend, he used to say. Now that Mr. Surowiecki is an august columnist (and blogger) for The New Yorker, he doesn't stoop to such entertainments anymore. But I'm happy to stoop!
docs.abstract: Another week when Washington was the center of the business world -- with consequences for the auto industry, banking, tobacco companies and executive pay.
docs.snippet: Another week when Washington was the center of the business world -- with consequences for the auto industry, banking, tobacco companies and executive pay.

docs.lead_paragraph: I have read every one of the more than 600 responses to Emmie, the young woman - 22, single, unexpectedly pregnant and about to start a prestigious, difficult graduate program - who wrote asking for readers' advice on what she should do. Emmie tells me she has read every word, too.
docs.abstract: Thoughts on the responses to Emmie, the young woman - 22, single, unexpectedly pregnant and about to start a prestigious, difficult graduate program - who wrote asking for readers' advice.
